alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Polk County Lower Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 9:21AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, southeastern Newton, southeastern Johnson, Scott, Polk, northwestern Yell, northwestern Montgomery and northwestern Pope Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 920 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Walnut to Booneville to 10 miles northwest of Broken Bow. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Mena... Booneville... Waldron... Paris... Lamar... London... Magazine... Wickes... Knoxville... Subiaco... Grannis... Hatfield... Scranton... Blue Mountain... Vandervoort... Holman... Dillen... Hinkle... Cossatot River State Park... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
